name: TikTok Photo Mode
primary_goal_vibe: Sequential visual storytelling and breakdowns using images instead of continuous video.
tone_preference: Narrative and clear, still fast and concise. Each frame should feel like a chapter.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: Use the caption to explain the story or structure behind the images. Each photo should be understandable on its own, but stronger as a sequence. Keep the caption focused on context, key takeaway, and CTA.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Line 1: explain what the carousel is (guide, breakdown, before/after). Body: 1–3 short lines of context or key points. Final line: CTA (save, share, or follow).
cta_examples: Save this for your next project
Comment which slide helped you most

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: Clarify each frame’s idea and help viewers follow the sequence.
best_practices: Big, legible text that fits mobile screens

hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Use tags for topic, format (for example tips, tutorial), and audience.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Tag collaborators or featured brands if they appear in the images.

technical_constraints.safe_area_note: Keep text away from extreme edges to avoid cropping.

required_elements: Clear theme or topic for the sequence
Readable text on each image if used
Logical progression from first to last frame
disallowed_practices: Random, unconnected images with no clear story
Dense text blocks that are hard to read
No explanation in the caption for complex sequences
Too many frames with minimal variation
